item.description:
Come Home to Malden!

 

 Okay a little humor there, but the Malden Drum Circle has just gone through a rebirthing process, and our new facilitator, Joe Hayes, ably assissted by his fellow nonsense-bringer Josh Fonshaker, wants to welcome you back to a recharged, rededicated and revamped Malden Drum! Remember those days when they'd be forty of us playing upstairs, and we'd lift the roof off the church with the power of our rhythms? Yeah, that Malden Drum Circle. It's back! If you've drummed with us before, please join us again! If you haven't, what are you waiting for?

And don't worry, we're still spreading those arms of rhythmic welcome wide open to Newbies as well.

We meet from 2:30-6 pm the third Sunday of each month, with a short beginners' class from 2:30-3:00, in which we'll learn a new rhythm each month.  Drummers, dancers, didgers, chanters, oboists, sax players-- truly all forms of musical expression are welcome to join us as we engage in the oldest form of community known to humanity-- the power of being one in the rhythm!  Suggested donation of $5. Bring your own drums, rattles, tamborines, etc-- don't have any? We do, and you can borrow! So no excuse not to come!

 

The First Parish in Malden, a Unitarian Universalist congregation, is located three blocks west of the Malden Center T station at 2 Elm Street (intersection with Pleasant Street), just off Route 60. Convenient, free parking is available between the church and the Beebe Elementary School. Visit MaldenUUA.org for directions and map.

We run this event once each month on the third Sunday of the month.

I look forward to seeing you all there!
item.name: Boston Drum and Dance Monthly Meetup
